result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case is adjourned for bail hearing in Branch 28.

Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles E Jackson Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Charles E Jackson Jr.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.
Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

JusticePoint Supervision Report dated September 26, 2022 - received
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles E Jackson Jr in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Charles E Jackson Jr.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State has filed an Amended Information.
Court grants State's filing of the Amended Information.
Arraignment held.

Amended Information received and filed.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and defense counsel entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. 

Defense counsel advises Court there is discovery which has not yet been received; discussion with the parties.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.
Court grants defendant's appearance via Zoom video for the next court hearing.

Clerk:  jms

State has filed an Amended Information:

Count 1:   HOMICIDE BY NEGLIGENT OPERATION OF A VEHICLE, a class G felony, contrary to sec. 940.10(1), 939.50(3)(g) Wis. Stats.

Count 2:   CARRYING A CONCEALED WEAPON, a class A misdemeanor, contrary to sec. 941.23(2), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats.

Count 3:   HOMICIDE BY INTOXICATED USE OF A VEHICLE (DETECTABLE AMOUNT OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE), a class D felony, contrary to sec. 940.09(1)(am), 939.50(3)(d) Wis. Stats.
Letter of support for defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles E Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Daneen Marbley via Zoom.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant to his continue treatment, no use or possession of controlled substances and no weapons.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Scheduling Conference on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 in Branch 28.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bail motion by the State argued; defense requests no bail modification; partially granted and partially denied by the Court.  

Court MODIFIES conditions of bail to include as follows:

-  Random urine screens
-  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.

Arraignment held.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.   Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for scheduling conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.

State requests to be heard as to bail.

JusticePoint Supervision Report dated July 12, 2022 - received

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   State requests an arraignment date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 28.  Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Cerniglia needs more time with client.
 Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.17.22
Received and filed
Filed: Notice-Motion to Increase Bail.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Charles E Jackson in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Charles E Jackson in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles E Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
